00200  static int pscip_open(struct inode *inode,struct file *filp)
00201 {
00202 
00203  pscip_Dev dev;                  // device information 
00204  int err = 0;                 
00205  dev = container_of(inode->i_cdev, npscip_Dev, cdev);       //getting the device structure out of char dev structure
00206  filp->private_data = dev;               //storing pointer to device information (pscip_Dev strucutre) in private_date for easier acces in future
00207 
00208  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00209  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_open() - start \n"); 
00210  #endif
00211 
00212  if (down_interruptible(&dev->sem))            //added by ML!!!!!!!!!!!!
00213   return -ERESTARTSYS;
00214 
00215  if(!dev->refcount)                //enabling/setting interrupts when oppening the device for the first time
00216  {
00217   err = pscip_assign_irq(dev);
00218   if(err)                  //if not able to assing interrupt, return the error
00219    goto err_assign_irq;
00220 
00221   err = k_irq_enable(dev);             //hardware interrupt initialization/enablin
00222   if(err)                  //if not able to assing interrupt, return the error
00223    goto err_irq_enable;
00224  }
00225  dev->refcount++;                // increment the reference coutner
00226  up(&dev->sem);                 //added by ML!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00227  
00228  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00229  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_open() - end \n"); 
00230  #endif
00231 
00232  return 0;                    // success 
00233  
00234  err_irq_enable:
00235   free_irq(dev->irq, (void *) dev);
00236  err_assign_irq:
00237   up(&dev->sem); 
00238  return err;
00239 }
00240 /* end pscip_open() */
00241 
00242 
00250  static int pscip_release(struct inode *inode,struct file *filp)
00251 {
00252 
00253  pscip_Dev dev;                  // device information 
00254  int err = 0;                 // error code
00255  dev = container_of(inode->i_cdev, npscip_Dev, cdev);       //getting the device structure out of char dev structure
00256  filp->private_data = dev;
00257  
00258  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00259  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_release() - beginnig \n"); 
00260  #endif
00261  
00262  if (down_interruptible(&dev->sem))            //added by ML!!!!!!!!!!!!
00263   return -ERESTARTSYS;
00264 
00265  if (dev->refcount)                //decrease reference counter
00266   dev->refcount--;
00267 
00268  if(!dev->refcount)                //if last closed reference, disable interrupts
00269  {
00270   err = k_irq_disable(dev); 
00271   if(err)                  //if not able to assing interrupt, return the error
00272    goto err_irq_disable;  
00273   free_irq(dev->irq, (void *) dev);           //Release interrupt handler when device is closed for the last time.
00274 
00275  }
00276 
00277  up(&dev->sem);                 //added by ML
00278 
00279  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00280  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_release() - end \n"); 
00281  #endif
00282  
00283  return 0;
00284 
00285  err_irq_disable:
00286   up(&dev->sem); 
00287   return err;
00288 }
00289 
00290 /* end pscip_release() */

00292 
00302  static int pscip_ioctl(struct inode *inode,struct file *filp,unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00303 {
00304  pscip_t val;
00305  int ret;
00306  pscip_fpga_t fpga_val;
00307  pscip_stats_t stats_val;
00308  int id_pscip = -1;             // use driver data struct  
00309  pscip_Dev dev = filp->private_data;         // device information
00310 
00311  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00312  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_ioctl() beginnig \n"); 
00313  #endif
00314  
00315 // lock ioctl to avoid race conditions 
00316  if (down_interruptible(&dev->sem))
00317   return -ERESTARTSYS;
00318  
00319  switch (cmd) 
00320  {   
00321  //Set high priority ps-current 
00322   case PSCIP_WRHIPRIO : 
00323   
00324    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00325    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Setting current -beginning\t--\n");
00326    #endif
00327    
00328    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00329    {  
00330     up(&dev->sem);
00331     return (-EFAULT);  
00332    }   
00333    if ((ret = k_pscip_wrhiprio(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) {    
00334     up(&dev->sem);
00335     return (-ret);
00336    } 
00337    
00338    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00339    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Setting current -finished\t--\n");
00340    #endif   
00341    
00342    break;   
00343  
00344  // Write action     
00345   case PSCIP_WRITE : 
00346    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00347    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Writing - beginning \t--\n");
00348    #endif  
00349   
00350 
00351    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t)))
00352    {   
00353     up(&dev->sem);
00354     return (-EFAULT);  
00355    }
00356    
00357    if ((ret = k_pscip_write(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00358    {   
00359      up(&dev->sem);
00360      return (-ret);
00361    }
00362    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00363    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Writing - finished \t--\n");
00364    #endif  
00365    
00366    break;
00367  
00368  // Read action   
00369   case PSCIP_READ:
00370 
00371    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00372    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Reading - beginning \t--\n");
00373    #endif 
00374    
00375    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00376    {   
00377     up(&dev->sem);
00378     return (-EFAULT);  
00379    }
00380   
00381    if ((ret = k_pscip_read(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00382    {
00383     up(&dev->sem);
00384       return (-ret);
00385    }   
00386 
00387   //copy entire I/O for link 1 memory to user space
00388    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &val, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00389    {
00390     up(&dev->sem);    
00391     return (-EFAULT);
00392    }
00393    
00394    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00395    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Reading - finished \t--\n");
00396    #endif 
00397    
00398    break; 
00399  
00400  // Write waveform action   
00401   case PSCIP_WRWAVE :  
00402 
00403    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00404    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Wave writing - beginning \t--\n");
00405    #endif 
00406    
00407    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00408    {   
00409     up(&dev->sem);
00410     return (-EFAULT);  
00411    }  
00412       
00413    if ((ret = k_pscip_wrwave(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00414    {    
00415     up(&dev->sem);    
00416     return (-ret);
00417    } 
00418 
00419    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00420    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: -\t Wave writing - finsihed \t--\n");
00421    #endif    
00422    break;
00423  
00424   case PSCIP_RDWAVE:
00425    
00426    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00427    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Wave reading - beginning \t--\n");
00428    #endif
00429    
00430   // Read waveform action    
00431    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00432    {   
00433     up(&dev->sem);
00434     return (-EFAULT);  
00435    }
00436   
00437    if ((ret = k_pscip_rdwave(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00438    {
00439     up(&dev->sem);    
00440     return (-ret);
00441    } 
00442 
00443    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &val, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00444    {
00445     up(&dev->sem);    
00446     return (-EFAULT);
00447    }
00448    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00449    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Wave reading - finished \t--\n");
00450    #endif 
00451   
00452    break;      
00453    
00454  //Read link register status   
00455   case PSCIP_RDLINKSTAT:
00456    
00457    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00458    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading link status - beginning \t--\n");
00459    #endif 
00460       
00461    if ((ret = k_pscip_rdlinkstat(&val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00462    {
00463     up(&dev->sem);    
00464     return (-ret);
00465    }    
00466 
00467    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &val, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00468    {
00469     up(&dev->sem);    
00470     return (-EFAULT);
00471    }
00472    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00473    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading link status - finished \t--\n");
00474    #endif 
00475    
00476    break;
00477  // Read FPGA status   
00478   case PSCIP_RDFPGASTAT:
00479   
00480    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00481    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading FPGA status - beginning \t--\n");
00482    #endif 
00483    
00484    if ((ret = k_pscip_rdfpgastat(&fpga_val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00485    {
00486     up(&dev->sem);    
00487     return (-ret);
00488    }    
00489   
00490    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &fpga_val, sizeof(pscip_fpga_t))) 
00491    {
00492     up(&dev->sem);    
00493     return (-EFAULT);
00494    }
00495    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00496    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading FPGA status - finished \t--\n");
00497    #endif 
00498    break;  
00499    
00500  // Read communication statistics  
00501   case PSCIP_RDSTATISTICS:
00502    
00503    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00504    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\n reading statistics - beginning \t--\n");
00505    #endif 
00506    
00507    if ((ret = k_pscip_rdstatistics(&stats_val, id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00508    {
00509     up(&dev->sem);    
00510     return (-ret);
00511    }    
00512    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &stats_val, sizeof (pscip_stats_t))) 
00513    {
00514     up(&dev->sem);    
00515     return (-EFAULT);
00516    }
00517    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00518    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading statistics - finished \t--\n");
00519    #endif 
00520    break;  
00521   
00522  //PCI carrier physical address of the beginning of interface registers:
00523   case PSCIP_PCIADDR:
00524  
00525    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00526    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reading PCI address - beginning \t--\n");
00527    #endif 
00528    
00529    ret = dev->pciaddr; 
00530  
00531    if (copy_to_user((void*) arg, &ret, sizeof (uint32_t))) 
00532    {
00533     up(&dev->sem);
00534     return (-EFAULT);
00535    } 
00536    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00537    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: ---\t reading PCI address - finished \t--\n");
00538    #endif   
00539    break;  
00540   
00541   case PSCIP_RESET:
00542    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00543    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t reseting - beginning \t--\n");
00544    #endif 
00545 
00546    if ((ret = k_pscip_reset(id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00547    {
00548     up(&dev->sem);    
00549     return (-ret);
00550    }
00551  
00552    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00553    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t finished - beginning \t--\n");
00554    #endif 
00555    break; 
00556    
00557   // Write given IP register - using pscip_t structure to pass the value from user, s
00558   // if pscip_t val;
00559   // we use val.stat -> to keep value to be writen to given IP register
00560   // we use val.address for keeping address
00561    case PSCIP_WRITEIPREG :  
00562    
00563    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00564    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t IP register writing - beginning \t--\n");
00565    #endif 
00566    
00567    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00568    {   
00569     up(&dev->sem);
00570     return (-EFAULT);  
00571    }  
00572    IP_write_byte(dev->pIP_IOspace[val.chan]+(val.address), val.stat);
00573 
00574    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00575    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t IP register writing - finsihed \t--\n");
00576    #endif    
00577    break;
00578   // read given IP register - using pscip_t structure to pass the value from user, s
00579   // if pscip_t val;
00580   // we use val.stat -> to keep value to be writen to given IP register
00581   // we use val.address for keeping address
00582   case PSCIP_READIPREG:
00583    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00584    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t IP register reading - beginning \t--\n");
00585    #endif 
00586    
00587    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00588    {   
00589     up(&dev->sem);
00590     return (-EFAULT);  
00591    }
00592    
00593    IP_read_byte(dev->pIP_IOspace[val.chan]+(val.address), &(val.stat));
00594 
00595    if (copy_to_user ((void*) arg, &val, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00596    {
00597     up(&dev->sem);    
00598     return (-EFAULT);
00599    }
00600    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00601    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t IP register reading - finished \t--\n");
00602    #endif 
00603   
00604    break;      
00605 
00606  //clear FPGA error counter 
00607   case PSCIP_CLRCOUNTER:
00608    
00609    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00610    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Clearing FPGA errro counter - beginning \t--\n");
00611    #endif 
00612    
00613    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00614    {   
00615     up(&dev->sem);
00616     return (-EFAULT);  
00617    }
00618    if ((ret = k_pscip_clear_err_counter(&val,id_pscip, dev)) < 0) 
00619    {
00620     up(&dev->sem);    
00621     return (-ret);
00622    }
00623    
00624    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00625    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: ---\t Clearing FPGA errro counter - finished \t--\n");
00626    #endif 
00627    
00628    break;
00629    
00630  //dump all IP registers  
00631   case PSCIP_DUMPFPGAREGS:
00632 
00633    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00634    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Reading content of all FPGA registers - beginning \t--\n");
00635    #endif 
00636    
00637    if (copy_from_user (&val, (void *) arg, sizeof (pscip_t))) 
00638    {   
00639     up(&dev->sem);
00640     return (-EFAULT);  
00641    }
00642    
00643    k_pscip_dump_all_registers&val, id_pscip, dev);
00644    
00645    #ifdef __DEBUG__
00646    IP_DEBUG_read_FPGA_stat(dev->pIP_IOspace[val.chan]+PSCIP_FPGA_REG);
00647    IP_DEBUG_read_IP_interface_reg(dev->pIPinterfaceReg);
00648    printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: --\t Reading content of all FPGA registers- finished \t--\n");
00649    #endif 
00650    
00651    break;  
00652  
00653   default: 
00654    up(&dev->sem);
00655    return -EINVAL;
00656   
00657  } // end switch  
00658 
00659  up(&dev->sem); 
00660  
00661  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00662  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_ioctl() - end\n"); 
00663  #endif
00664 
00665  return 0;
00666  
00667 }

00669 /* end pscip_ioctl() */

00671 /*****************************************************************
00672  *                        IRQ Handler                            *
00673  *****************************************************************/
00686 void pscip_irq_bh0(unsigned long data)
00687 //irqreturn_t pscip_irq_bh0(unsigned long data)
00688 {
00689 
00690  pscip_Dev dev = (pscip_Dev *) data;
00691  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00692  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: >>>>>>>>>>>>> T A S K L E T  <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<\n"); 
00693  #endif
00694  if (!dev) 
00695   return;
00696 //  return IRQ_NONE;
00697   
00698  spin_lock(&dev->lock[0]);
00699  queue_flag = 1;
00700  wake_up_interruptible(&dev->queue[0]);
00701  spin_unlock(&dev->lock[0]);
00702 
00703  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00704  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_irq_bh0() - end\n"); 
00705  #endif
00706 }
00707  /* end pscip_irq_bh0 */
00708 
00709 
00722 void pscip_irq_bh1(unsigned long data)
00723 //irqreturn_t pscip_irq_bh1(unsigned long data)
00724 {
00725 
00726  pscip_Dev dev = (pscip_Dev *) data;
00727  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00728  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: >>>>>>>>>>>>> T A S K L E T  <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<\n"); 
00729  #endif 
00730  
00731  if (!dev) 
00732   return; 
00733 //  return IRQ_NONE;
00734   
00735  spin_lock(&dev->lock[1]);
00736  queue_flag = 1;
00737  wake_up_interruptible(&dev->queue[1]);
00738  spin_unlock(&dev->lock[1]);
00739  
00740 
00741  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00742  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_irq_bh1() - end\n"); 
00743  #endif
00744 }
00745

00750 
00761 irqreturn_t pscip_irq_handler(int pciirq, void *dev_id, struct pt_regs *regs)
00762 {
00763 
00764  pscip_Dev dev = dev_id;
00765  uint32_t chan,err;
00766  uint16_t word;
00767 
00768   if (!(ioread32(dev->pPCIinterfaceReg + 0x4c ) & PLX9030_INTCSR_LINTI1_STAT))
00769       return IRQ_NONE;
00770  chan = k_if_handle_irq(dev);
00771  if(chan < 0)   //check whether interrupt is connected with the give IP, if yes, value greater than 0 is returned, ex, for IP 1, interrupt 0 is registererd
00772   return IRQ_NONE;
00773  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00774  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: >>>>>>>>>>>>> I T E R R U P T  <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<\n"); 
00775  #endif 
00776  
00777 // reset error flag
00778   dev->stats[chan].err_flag = 0;
00779  
00780 // to avoid interrupt flooding read immediately status register 
00781  IP_read_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_REG_STAT, &word);
00782 
00783  if (word == 0) 
00784   dev->stats[chan].err_flag |= PSCIP_ERROR_MSK;
00785  
00786 // check errors in status register 
00787  if (word & PSCIP_ERROR_MSK) 
00788  {
00789  // general error 
00790   dev->stats[chan].err_flag |= PSCIP_ERROR_MSK;
00791  
00792  //read FPGA error counter  - pasuje
00793   IP_read_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_FPGA_HIGH, &word);
00794   err = (word >> 8) & 0xff;
00795  // check what kind of error happened; update error stats 
00796   if (word & PSCIP_LINKDOWN_MSK) 
00797   {
00798    dev->stats[chan].err_flag |= PSCIP_LINKDOWN_MSK;
00799    dev->stats[chan].linkdown_cnt += err;
00800   }
00801  // check what kind of error happened; update error stats 
00802   if (word & PSCIP_TXERR_MSK)
00803   {
00804    dev->stats[chan].err_flag |= PSCIP_TXERR_MSK;
00805    dev->stats[chan].txerr_cnt += err;
00806   }   
00807   
00808  // check link errors 
00809   IP_read_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_FPGA_MID, &word);
00810 
00811   dev->stats[chan].link_err_flag[PSCIP_WRHPRIO_IDX] = ((word>>10) & 0x1f);
00812   dev->stats[chan].link_err_flag[PSCIP_WRITE_IDX] = ((word>>5) & 0x1f);
00813   dev->stats[chan].link_err_flag[PSCIP_READ_IDX] = (word & 0x1f);
00814   
00815   IP_read_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_FPGA_LOW, &word);  
00816 
00817   dev->stats[chan].link_err_flag[PSCIP_WRWAVE_IDX] = ((word>>5) & 0x1f);
00818   dev->stats[chan].link_err_flag[PSCIP_RDWAVE_IDX] = (word & 0x1f);  
00819 
00820  // clear errors from FPGA 
00821   IP_write_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_FPGA_HIGH,PSCIP_ERRCLEAR_MSK | 0x0);
00822   IP_write_word(dev->pIP_IOspace[chan] + PSCIP_FPGA_LOW,0x0);       //writing low word so that the FPGA reads all register (6 bytes)
00823  }
00824 
00825  dev->irqflag[chan] = PSCIP_IRQ_SERVED;
00826 
00827 // wake up read/write 
00828  #ifndef RTAI 
00829   tasklet_hi_schedule(&dev->pscip_tsk[chan]); 
00830  #endif
00831 
00832  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00833  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_irq_handler() - end\n"); 
00834  #endif
00835  return IRQ_HANDLED;
00836 } 
00837 /* end irqhandler */
00838 
00844  int pscip_assign_irq(pscip_Dev dev)
00845 {
00846  int err;
00847  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00848  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_assign_irq() - beginning\n"); 
00849  #endif
00850  
00851  err = request_irq(
00852                 dev->irq,
00853                 pscip_irq_handler,                    //& pscip_irq_handler ->>????
00854     SA_SHIRQ,                      // PCI interrupts have to be shared
00855                 "pscip",
00856                 dev);
00857  if (err)
00858   printk(KERN_ALERT "Cannot reguster interrupt %d\n", dev->irq);
00859  
00860  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00861  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_assign_irq() - end\n");
00862  #endif
00863  
00864  return err;
00865 }
00866 /*****************************************************************
00867  *                      procfs calls                             *
00868  *****************************************************************/
00879  static int pscip_read_proc(char *page, char **start, off_t offset, int count, int *eof, void *data)
00880 {
00881 
00882  pscip_Proc procdev = data;
00883  pscip_Dev dev = &pscip_devices[procdev->count];
00884 
00885  int len = 0,
00886      id_pscip = -1,                // if parameter id_pscip passed to function k_pscip_rdfpgastat() with negative value - the function reads passed by third arg device struct
00887   i;
00888  pscip_fpga_t fpga_val; 
00889  
00890   len += sprintf(page+len, "\n ************ PSCIP Driver ver.%s ********\n",ver);
00891  
00892  if(!dev->IP_in_slot)               //check whether the IP was detected in the slot
00893  {
00894   len += sprintf(page+len, " - IP %d not detected in slot on carrier %d  --\n",dev->IPnumber,dev->carrier_number);
00895   len += sprintf(page+len, " --- No information about IP can be provided---\n");
00896  }
00897  else                   // IP was detected in the slot - show the info
00898  {
00899   len += sprintf(page+len, " ----- IP number %d on carrier number %d  -----\n",dev->IPnumber,dev->carrier_number);
00900    for (i = 0; i < PSCIP_MAX_CHAN; i++) 
00901   {
00902   len += sprintf(page+len, "\n --------------------- Channel %d -------------\n",i);
00903    len += sprintf(page+len, " Link status: ");
00904 
00905    fpga_val.channel = i;
00906    if (k_pscip_rdfpgastat(&fpga_val, id_pscip, dev) < 0)
00907     goto out;
00908    if (fpga_val.high_data & PSCIP_LINKDOWN_MSK)
00909     len += sprintf(page+len, "link down\n");
00910    else if (fpga_val.high_data & PSCIP_TXERR_MSK)
00911     len += sprintf(page+len, "tx error\n");    
00912    else {
00913     len += sprintf(page+len, "ok\n");
00914     len += sprintf(page+len, "  Csontroller status:\n");
00915     if (dev->stats[i].cntrl_stat & PSCIP_INPUTBUF_MSK)
00916      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - Buffer full\n");
00917     else
00918      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - Buffer not full\n");   
00919     if (dev->stats[i].cntrl_stat & PSCIP_DSP_MSK)
00920      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - DSP stopped\n");
00921     else
00922      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - DSP running\n"); 
00923     if (dev->stats[i].cntrl_stat & PSCIP_REMLOC_MSK)
00924      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - Local control\n");
00925     else
00926      len += sprintf(page+len, "    - Remote control\n");       
00927    }
00928     
00929    len += sprintf(page+len, "  Rx packets: %d\n",dev->stats[i].rx);
00930    len += sprintf(page+len, "  Tx packets: %d\n",dev->stats[i].tx);
00931    len += sprintf(page+len, "  Tx errors:  %d\n",dev->stats[i].txerr_cnt); 
00932    len += sprintf(page+len, "  Link errors: %d\n",dev->stats[i].linkdown_cnt);
00933   
00934   } 
00935  }
00936  len += sprintf(page+len, "\n");
00937  *eof = 1; 
00938  return len;
00939 
00940  //IP error 
00941  out:
00942   printk(KERN_ERR "PSCIP error\n"); 
00943   len+=sprintf(page+len, " PSCIP error\n\n");
00944   *eof = 1; 
00945   up(&dev->sem);
00946 
00947  return len; 
00948 
00949  return 0;  //added for 2.6 - temporary to avoid warnings
00950 }
00951 
00952 
00953 /* end pscip_read_proc() */
00954 
00955 
00964  static int pscip_write_proc(struct file *filp, const char *buffer, unsigned long count, void *data)
00965 {
00966  pscip_Proc procdev = data; 
00967  pscip_Dev dev = &pscip_devices[procdev->count];
00968  uint32_t wval1 = 0,wval2 = 0, wval3 = 0, wval4=0;
00969  pscip_t val;
00970  unsigned int code;
00971  int id_pscip = -1;
00972  int ret = 0; 
00973  #ifdef __DEBUG__
00974  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_write_proc - beginning\n");
00975  #endif  
00976  
00977  sscanf(buffer, "%d %x %x %x %x\n", &code /*command number*/ \
00978          , &wval1 /*channel*/ \
00979          , &wval2 /*status*/ \
00980          , &wval3 /*address*/ \
00981          , &wval4 /*data*/); 
00982      
00983  
00984 // lock ioctl to avoid race conditions 
00985  if (down_interruptible(&dev->sem))
00986   return -ERESTARTSYS;
00987  
00988 // check channel value; 0 or 1 are allowed 
00989  if ((wval1 > 1) && (code <= PSCIP_PROC_WRWAVE))          //if we want to write, the channel must be 0 or 1
00990   goto out;
00991  
00992  if ((code > PSCIP_PROC_WRWAVE) && (code != PSCIP_PROC_RESET))      //if we want to reset, entire IP is reseted - does not matter which channel
00993   goto out;
00994   
00995  switch (code) 
00996  {
00997  // high priority write 
00998   case PSCIP_PROC_HPRIO: 
00999    val.chan = wval1;
01000    val.stat = wval2;  
01001    val.address = wval3;
01002    val.data = wval4;   
01003    if((ret = k_pscip_wrhiprio(&val, id_pscip, dev))<0) 
01004     goto out;   
01005    break;
01006  //write
01007   case PSCIP_PROC_WRITE: 
01008    val.chan = wval1;
01009    val.stat = wval2;  
01010    val.address = wval3;
01011    val.data = wval4;    
01012    if((ret = k_pscip_write(&val, id_pscip, dev))<0) 
01013     goto out;   
01014    break;  
01015  //write wave
01016   case PSCIP_PROC_WRWAVE: 
01017    val.chan = wval1;
01018    val.stat = wval2;  
01019    val.address = wval3;
01020    val.data = wval4;    
01021    if((ret = k_pscip_wrwave(&val, id_pscip, dev))<0) 
01022     goto out;   
01023    break;
01024  //reset IP 
01025   case PSCIP_PROC_RESET: 
01026 
01027    if((ret = k_pscip_reset(id_pscip, dev))<0) 
01028     goto out;   
01029    break;
01030   
01031   default:  
01032    return -EINVAL;
01033  }
01034  
01035  up(&dev->sem);  
01036  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01037  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_write_proc - en\n");
01038  #endif 
01039  
01040  return count;
01041 
01042  out:
01043   printk(KERN_ERR "PSCIP error\n");
01044   up(&dev->sem);
01045   return count;
01046 
01047  
01048 }
01049 
01050 /* end pscip_write_proc() */
01051 
01052 
01058  static int pscip_procfs_register(void)
01059 {
01060 
01061  struct proc_dir_entry *procfs_file;
01062  char root_dir[30]="driver", model_dir[30], dev_dir[10];
01063  int i,k;
01064  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01065  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: pscip_procfs_register - beginning\n");
01066  #endif 
01067 
01068 // register proc entry under "driver" entry 
01069  sprintf(model_dir,"%s/%s",root_dir,module_name);
01070  proc_model_dir = proc_mkdir(model_dir, NULL);
01071  if (proc_model_dir == NULL)
01072   goto err_proc_mkdir;
01073  
01074 // allocate proc device data structure 
01075  pscip_procdev = kmalloc(pscip_dev_number*sizeof(npscip_Proc), GFP_KERNEL);
01076  if (!pscip_procdev) 
01077   goto err_kmalloc;
01078   
01079  memset(pscip_procdev, 0, pscip_dev_number*sizeof(npscip_Proc));
01080  //  example of proc filesystem entry
01081  // /proc/driver/pscip/ pscip0
01082  // /proc/driver/pscip/pscip1
01083  // .....
01084  // /proc/driver/pscip/pscippN
01085        
01086  for (i = 0; i < pscip_dev_number; i++) 
01087  {
01088   sprintf(dev_dir,"pscip%d",i);
01089   procfs_file = create_proc_entry(dev_dir, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, proc_model_dir);
01090   if (procfs_file == NULL) 
01091   {
01092 //release also proc_fs successfull registered entries   
01093    for (k = 0; k < i; k++) 
01094    {
01095      sprintf(dev_dir,"pscip%d",i); 
01096     remove_proc_entry(dev_dir, proc_model_dir);
01097    }
01098    goto err_create_proc_entry;
01099 
01100   }
01101   pscip_procdev[i].count = i;                   // i=device (minor) number 
01102   
01103 // initialize proc filesystem file entries 
01104   procfs_file->data = &pscip_procdev[i];
01105   procfs_file->read_proc = pscip_read_proc;
01106   procfs_file->write_proc = pscip_write_proc;
01107  }
01108  
01109  return 0;
01110       
01111  err_create_proc_entry:
01112   kfree(pscip_procdev);
01113  err_kmalloc:
01114   remove_proc_entry(model_dir, NULL);
01115  err_proc_mkdir:
01116    
01117 
01118    return -ENOMEM;  
01119    
01120 }
01121 
01122 /* end pscip_procfs_register() */
01123 
01124 
01125 /*************************************************************************************/
01126 
01135 static void init_pscip(int i)
01136 { 
01137  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01138  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: init_pscip() - beginning\n"); 
01139  #endif
01140 
01141 // initialize tasklet; channel 0/1
01142  tasklet_init(&pscip_devices[i].pscip_tsk[0],pscip_irq_bh0, (unsigned long)&pscip_devices[i]);      
01143  tasklet_init(&pscip_devices[i].pscip_tsk[1],pscip_irq_bh1, (unsigned long)&pscip_devices[i]); 
01144 
01145 // initialize locks; channel 0/1  
01146  spin_lock_init(&pscip_devices[i].lock[0]);
01147  spin_lock_init(&pscip_devices[i].lock[1]); 
01148 
01149 
01150 // initialize queues; channel 0/1 
01151  init_waitqueue_head(&pscip_devices[i].queue[0]);
01152  init_waitqueue_head(&pscip_devices[i].queue[1]); 
01153  
01154  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01155  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: spin waitqueue initialized 1\n"); 
01156  #endif
01157  
01158 // reset timestamp registers; channel 0/1 
01159  do_gettimeofday(&pscip_devices[i].tv[0]);pscip_devices[i].tv[0].tv_sec -= PSCIP_LINKDOWN_TOUT+1;
01160  do_gettimeofday(&pscip_devices[i].tv[1]);pscip_devices[i].tv[1].tv_sec -= PSCIP_LINKDOWN_TOUT+1;
01161 
01162  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01163  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: init_pscip() - end\n"); 
01164  #endif
01165 
01166 }
01167 
01168 /* end init_pscip */
01169 
01170 
01174 static int checkmem_device(int i)
01175 {
01176   uint8_t model_id = 0;
01177   uint8_t manufacture_id = 0;
01178   
01179   IP_read_byte(pscip_devices[i].pIP_IOspace[0] + PSCIP_MODEL_REG, &model_id);
01180   IP_read_byte(pscip_devices[i].pIP_IOspace[0] + PSCIP_MANIFAC_REG ,&manufacture_id);
01181   if ((model_id != PSCIP_MODEL_ID) || (manufacture_id != PSCIP_MANIFAC_ID)) 
01182   { 
01183    printk(KERN_ERR "PSCIP PS controller model error; model id: 0x%x manufacturer id 0x%x\n If the values are 0xFF, it is most probable there is no IP in the SLOT on the carrier. \n Check slot number: %d\n",model_id,manufacture_id,pscip_devices[i].IPnumber);      
01184    return -EFAULT ; 
01185   } 
01186 
01187 
01188  return 0;
01189 
01190 }
01191 /* end checkmem_device() */
01192 
01202 static int probe(struct pci_dev *dev, const struct pci_device_id *id)
01203 {
01204 
01205  int index;                    //count the number of already registered IPs, indicates the first IP on the carrier
01206  int err;                    //error
01207  int i = 0 ;                    //IP on the carrier
01208  int devno;                     //
01209  int carrier_number;                  //carrier number
01210  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01211  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: probe() - beginning\n");
01212  pscip_get_PCI_info(dev) ;
01213  #endif 
01214 
01215  if((dev == NULL) || (id == NULL))               //not good but I don't know what it means
01216  {
01217   printk(KERN_ALERT "probe(): (dev == NULL) || (id == NULL)\n"); 
01218   return -1;
01219  }
01220  
01221  for(index = 0; (index < pscip_dev_number) && (pscip_devices[index].IPnumber >= 0); ++index);//finding out the first free device number
01222  if(index == pscip_dev_number - 1)              //if there are no 2 free device numbers - no good, we need two device numbers for one carrier
01223  {
01224   printk(KERN_ERR "\n%s: No free place in driver_struct, the number of PCI carriers\
01225   pluged in this computer extended the number you declared when installing the driver\
01226   (%d). You need to reinsert the driver with an appropriate \
01227   number.\n\n", "PSCIP", pscip_dev_number);
01228   err = index;
01229   goto err_pscip_dev_number;
01230  }
01231  else
01232  {
01233   carrier_number = index % MAX_NUMER_OF_IPs_ON_CARRIER;
01234   num_pscip = index + 1;
01235   printk(KERN_INFO "\n%s: The IPs on the Carrier nr %d will be represented by: \n \
01236   Major number: %d, minor numbers: %d and %d. \n \
01237   In the /proc/driver IPs will be represented bb: \n \
01238   /dev/pscip%d  and /dev/pscip%d nodes \n\n",module_name, carrier_number, pscip_major, pscip_minor + index, \
01239   pscip_minor + index + 1, pscip_minor + index, pscip_minor + index + 1);
01240  }
01241  
01242 
01243  
01244 
01245 //initializing cdev structure embedded in device structure
01246  for( i = 0; i < 2; i++)
01247  {
01248   cdev_init(&pscip_devices[index + i].cdev, &pscip_fops);         
01249   pscip_devices[index + i].cdev.owner = THIS_MODULE;
01250   pscip_devices[index + i].cdev.ops = &pscip_fops;  
01251 
01252 // initialize queues   
01253   init_waitqueue_head(&pscip_devices[index + i].queue[0]);
01254   init_waitqueue_head(&pscip_devices[index + i].queue[1]);       
01255   
01256 // initialize semaphores 
01257   #ifdef RTAI
01258    rt_sem_init(&pscip_devices[index + i].rt_sem[0],1); 
01259    rt_sem_init(&pscip_devices[index + i].rt_sem[1],1);
01260   #endif
01261   sema_init(&pscip_devices[index + i].sem,1);     
01262 
01263   devno = MKDEV(pscip_major, pscip_minor + index + i);
01264 
01265 // AS SOON AS cdev_add  RETURNS, THE DEVICE IS "LIVE" AND ITS OPERATION S CAN BE CALLED BY THE KERNEL
01266   err = cdev_add (&(pscip_devices[index + i].cdev), devno, 1);
01267   if (err)
01268   {
01269    printk(KERN_NOTICE "Error %d adding pscip%d", err, index + i);
01270    goto err_cdev_add;
01271   }
01272   sprintf(pscip_devices[index + i].device_name, "%s%d", "pscip", index + i);
01273   pscip_devices[index + i].carrier_number   =  carrier_number;    //can be helpfull to physically recognise which carrier it is
01274   pscip_devices[index + i].IPnumber    =  i;       // A BIG PROBLEM : there are two IPs
01275   pscip_devices[index + i].pscip_number   =  index + i;     //number of all registered IPs, starting with 0
01276 
01277  } 
01278 
01279 //initialization of pci_dev structure embeded in device structure - it is embedded in the structure of the first IP on the Carrier only !!!!!!
01280   pscip_devices[index].pcidev = dev;
01281   pci_set_drvdata(dev, &(pscip_devices[index]));
01282 
01283   
01284 // enable PCI device  accessing it 
01285   err = pci_enable_device(dev);
01286   if(err)
01287   {
01288    printk(KERN_NOTICE "Could not enable PCI device");
01289    goto err_pci_enable_device; 
01290   }
01291   
01292   err = pci_request_regions(dev,"pscip");
01293   if(err)
01294   { 
01295    printk(KERN_NOTICE "Negative answer to requesting I/O region for PCI");
01296    goto err_pci_request_region; 
01297   }
01298 
01299 // initialization of the PCI carrier parameters - accessing the device - getting the location (physica) of registers
01300  for( i = 0; i < 2; i++)
01301  {
01302   pscip_devices[index + i].pciaddr    =  pci_resource_start(dev, 0);  //a bit stupid - did to keep the code similar to vme code but make no sense to have this address so it will have to be changed later
01303  // PCI Configuration register
01304   pscip_devices[index + i].PCIinterfaceAddr  =  pci_resource_start(dev, 0);
01305   pscip_devices[index + i].PCIinterfaceLen  =  pci_resource_len(dev, 0);
01306   pscip_devices[index + i].PCIinterfaceFlags  =  pci_resource_flags(dev, 0);
01307  //IP Interface register
01308   pscip_devices[index + i].IPinterfaceAddr  =  pci_resource_start(dev, 2);
01309   pscip_devices[index + i].IPinterfaceLen   =  pci_resource_len(dev, 2);
01310   pscip_devices[index + i].IPinterfaceFlags  =  pci_resource_flags(dev, 2);
01311  //I/O space memory region - here we communicate with IP,
01312   pscip_devices[index + i].IP_IOspaceAddr   =  pci_resource_start(dev, 3);
01313   pscip_devices[index + i].IP_IOspaceLen   =  pci_resource_len(dev, 3);
01314   pscip_devices[index + i].IP_IOspaceFlags  =  pci_resource_flags(dev, 3);
01315   //interrupts
01316   pscip_devices[index + i].irq     =  dev->irq;       //I am not sure about that
01317   
01318 //mapping PCI regions to kernel addressing -> getting the virtual addresses which will be used to accessing the registers
01319   pscip_devices[index + i].pPCIinterfaceReg  =  pci_iomap(dev, 0, pscip_devices[index + i].PCIinterfaceLen); 
01320   pscip_devices[index + i].pIPinterfaceReg  =  pci_iomap(dev, 2, pscip_devices[index + i].IPinterfaceLen);
01321 
01322   if(i == 1)  
01323    pscip_devices[index + i].pIP_IOspace[0]  =  pci_iomap(dev, 3, pscip_devices[index + i].IP_IOspaceLen) + PSCIP_IP_OFFSET;  //virtual address of channel 0 on IP 1
01324   else
01325    pscip_devices[index + i].pIP_IOspace[0]  =  pci_iomap(dev, 3, pscip_devices[index + i].IP_IOspaceLen);       //virtual address of channel 0 on IP 0
01326 
01327   pscip_devices[index + i].pIP_IOspace[1]   =  pscip_devices[index + i].pIP_IOspace[0] + PSCIP_CHAN_OFFSET;      //virtual address of channel 1 on IP 0 or 1
01328 
01329 //check whether the IP is in the slot
01330   if(! checkmem_device(index + i))
01331   {
01332    pscip_devices[index + i].IP_in_slot   =  TRUE;
01333    printk(KERN_INFO "\nIP was detected in the slot %d on the Carrier number %d\n\n",pscip_devices[index + i].IPnumber, pscip_devices[index + i].carrier_number); 
01334   }
01335   else
01336   {
01337    pscip_devices[index + i].IP_in_slot   =  FALSE;
01338    printk(KERN_ALERT "\nOn Carrier %d IP %d was not detected in the slot\n\n",pscip_devices[index + i].carrier_number,pscip_devices[index + i].IPnumber); 
01339   }
01340     
01341   if (! pscip_devices[index + i].pPCIinterfaceReg ) 
01342   {
01343    printk(KERN_NOTICE "\nCould not allocate virtual address\n\n");
01344       goto err_virtaul_alloc;
01345   }
01346   if (! pscip_devices[index + i].pIPinterfaceReg ) 
01347   {
01348    printk(KERN_NOTICE "\nCould not allocate virtual address\n\n");
01349       goto err_virtaul_alloc;
01350   }
01351 
01352   if (! pscip_devices[index + i].pIP_IOspace[0] ) 
01353   { 
01354    printk(KERN_NOTICE "\nCould not allocate virtual address\n\n");
01355       goto err_virtaul_alloc;
01356   }
01357 
01358   
01359   init_pscip(index + i);
01360   
01361   
01362  }
01363  
01364  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01365  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: probe() - end\n");
01366  #endif 
01367 
01368 
01369    return 0;
01370  
01371  err_virtaul_alloc:
01372   pci_release_regions(dev);
01373  err_pci_request_region:
01374    pci_disable_device(dev);
01375  err_pci_enable_device:
01376   cdev_del(&pscip_devices[index].cdev);
01377   cdev_del(&pscip_devices[index + 1].cdev);
01378  err_cdev_add:
01379  err_pscip_dev_number:
01380  
01381  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01382  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: probe() - end ended with error\n");
01383  #endif 
01384  return err;
01385 
01386 }
01387  
01393 static void remove(struct pci_dev *pcidev)
01394 {
01395 
01396  pscip_Dev dev = pci_get_drvdata(pcidev);           //retreaveing device structure from pci_dev structure - only dev structure of the first IP on the carrier can be obtained in such a way
01397  int index = dev->pscip_number;              //finding out the IP number of the first IP on the Carrier
01398   pci_iounmap(pcidev, dev->pPCIinterfaceReg);           //unmapping virtual address
01399   pci_iounmap(pcidev, dev->pIPinterfaceReg);           //unmapping virtual address
01400  pci_iounmap(pcidev, dev->pIP_IOspace[0]);           //unmapping virtual address
01401   pci_release_regions(pcidev);              //releasing region
01402   pci_disable_device(pcidev);               //disabling PCI carrier
01403  cdev_del(&pscip_devices[index].cdev);            //char device deletion of first IP on the carrier
01404  cdev_del(&pscip_devices[index + 1].cdev);           //char device deletion of second IP on the carrier
01405 
01406  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01407  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: remove()- end\n"); 
01408  #endif 
01409 
01410 }
01411 
01412 
01413 
01417 static void exit_pscip_module(void)
01418 { 
01419  dev_t chrdev = 0;                 // dev_t structure needed to supply unregister_chrdev_region with parameter
01420  int i;                    // counting IPs
01421  char root_dir[30]="driver", model_dir[30], dev_dir[10];        // used for proc fs 
01422  
01423  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01424  printk(KERN_ALERT "exit_pscip_module() - beginning\n"); 
01425  #endif 
01426  
01427  chrdev = MKDEV(pscip_major, pscip_minor);           //populate dev_t
01428  
01429 // kfree(pscip_devices);                //free kallocated memory
01430  unregister_chrdev_region(chrdev,pscip_dev_number);         //use chrdev to free chrdev region
01431  pci_unregister_driver(&pscip_driver);            // give holidays for poor PCI
01432 
01433  for (i = 0; i < pscip_dev_number; i++) 
01434  {                    
01435   sprintf(dev_dir,"pscip%d",i);
01436   remove_proc_entry(dev_dir, proc_model_dir);          //removing proc entrie
01437  } 
01438  sprintf(model_dir,"%s/%s",root_dir,module_name);
01439  remove_proc_entry(model_dir,NULL);             //goodbye to proc fs
01440 
01441  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01442  printk(KERN_ALERT "exit_pscip_module() - end\n"); 
01443  #endif 
01444 }
01445 /* end cleanup_module */
01446  
01447 
01448 
01455 static int init_pscip_module(void)
01456 { 
01457  
01458     int i = 0;                   //counting device
01459     int j = 0;                   //counting channel
01460  dev_t chrdev = 0; 
01461  int err = 0;                  //error value
01462  
01463  printk(KERN_INFO "\n************ PSCI driver ***********\n");
01464  printk(KERN_INFO "* for kernel 2.6 and PCI interface *\n");
01465  printk(KERN_INFO "*     very development version     *\n");
01466  printk(KERN_INFO "************************************\n\n");
01467  
01468  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01469  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: init_pscip_module() - beginning\n"); 
01470  #endif 
01471 //determining number of IPs
01472  if(pscip_dev_number==0)                //if the number of IPs is not provided when inserting the module, a DEFAULT number is set
01473   pscip_dev_number = PSCIP_DEFAULT_DEV;
01474  if(pscip_dev_number >= PSCIP_MAX_DEV)            // the number of devices cannot be greater than MAX_DEV
01475  {
01476   printk("ERROR: numer of devices passed as a parameter \
01477   pscip_dev_number = %d is greater than maximum allowed \
01478   number: %d \n",pscip_dev_number,PSCIP_MAX_DEV);
01479   return -EPERM;                 //operation not permitted
01480  }
01481 //char device registration
01482  if (pscip_major)                  // if the major number is determine by the user (passing by parameter) than we use this method to register character device
01483  {
01484   chrdev = MKDEV(pscip_major, pscip_minor);          //putting major and minor number into dev_t structure - > not allowed to do it by hand, need to use macro
01485   err = register_chrdev_region(chrdev, pscip_dev_number, "pscip");    //registering region to the device numbers determined by the user
01486  } 
01487  else                    //dynamic allocation of major number if it is not defined by user - preffered way
01488  {
01489   err = alloc_chrdev_region(&chrdev, pscip_minor, pscip_dev_number, "pscip");  //dynamically alllocating device numbers (major and minor)
01490   pscip_major = MAJOR(chrdev);             // finding out what was allocated
01491  }
01492  if (err < 0) 
01493  {
01494   printk("ERROR: Cannot register device number\n");
01495   goto err_chrdev_region;
01496  }
01497 
01498 //memory allocation
01499 /*
01500  pscip_devices = kmalloc(pscip_dev_number*sizeof(npscip_Dev), GFP_KERNEL);   //because the number od devices can be chosen dynamically, we allocate memory for the table of device structures dynamically, kmalloc is needed
01501  if (!pscip_devices) 
01502  {
01503   printk("ERROR: Cannot register device number\n");
01504   goto err_kmalloc;
01505  }
01506 */
01507  memset(pscip_devices, 0, sizeof(pscip_Dev)*pscip_dev_number);      //allocate and clear memory for all devices
01508 
01509 //parameters initialization for all devices
01510  for(i = 0; i < pscip_dev_number; i++)
01511  {
01512   pscip_devices[i].pciaddr = 0;               // pci (physical) address 
01513   for(j = 0; j < PSCIP_MAX_CHAN; j++)  
01514   {
01515    pscip_devices[i].irqflag[j] = 0;           
01516    pscip_devices[i].irqdata[j] = 0;
01517   }
01518   pscip_devices[i].PCIinterfaceAddr = 0;           //address (physical) of PCI interface registers
01519   pscip_devices[i].PCIinterfaceLen = 0;           // length of PCI interface register
01520   pscip_devices[i].PCIinterfaceFlags = 0;
01521   pscip_devices[i].IPinterfaceAddr = 0;             //address  (physical)  of IP interface register - local adress 2
01522   pscip_devices[i].IPinterfaceLen = 0;           //length  (physical)  of IP interface register 
01523   pscip_devices[i].IPinterfaceFlags = 0;
01524   pscip_devices[i].IP_IOspaceAddr = 0;           //address  (physical)  of the beginnning of IP I/O space - local addrress 3
01525   pscip_devices[i].IP_IOspaceLen = 0;            //length of IP I/O space 
01526   pscip_devices[i].IP_IOspaceFlags = 0;
01527   
01528   pscip_devices[i].pPCIinterfaceReg = NULL;          //virtual address of PIC interface regs
01529   pscip_devices[i].pIPinterfaceReg = NULL;          //Local space 0  (virtual address)
01530 
01531   for(j = 0; j < PSCIP_MAX_CHAN; j++)  
01532    pscip_devices[i].pIP_IOspace[j] = NULL;          //virtual address: chan=0 for link 1 and chan=1 for link 2
01533   
01534   pscip_devices[i].IPnumber = -1;             //there are max two IPs on one carrier: 0 or 1 - used to knwo which one to reset
01535   pscip_devices[i].carrier_number = -1 ;           //number of the carrier starting from the carrier with the lowest PCI address (hopefully)
01536   pscip_devices[i].refcount = 0;             //keeps the number of opened devices
01537   pscip_devices[i].irq = 0;              // interrupt line number
01538   pscip_devices[i].IP_in_slot = FALSE;
01539  } 
01540 
01541 //proc file system init
01542  err = pscip_procfs_register();              //create representation of PSCIP in /proc/driver
01543  if (err < 0) 
01544  {
01545   printk(KERN_ERR "can't register proc filesystem\n");
01546   goto err_pscip_procfs_register;
01547  } 
01548  
01549  if (pci_register_driver(&pscip_driver) != 0)           // register pci driver as soon as registered the probe is called for each carrier
01550  {
01551   printk("Failed to register 'pci_driver' \n");
01552   goto err_pci_register;
01553  }
01554  
01555 //info 
01556  printk(KERN_INFO "\n The module %s has been successfully inserted\n", "pscip"); 
01557  printk(KERN_INFO "The module is represented by Major Nuber: %d and minor numbers:\
01558  %d to %d\n\n", pscip_major, pscip_minor, (pscip_minor + pscip_dev_number - 1)); 
01559 
01560  
01561  #ifdef __DEBUG__
01562  printk(KERN_ALERT "DEBUG_M: init_pscip_module() - end, the device has been registered with device major number: %d\n",pscip_major); 
01563  #endif 
01564 
01565 
01566  return 0;
01567  
01568 //error 
01569  err_pscip_procfs_register:
01570   kfree(pscip_devices);
01571 // err_kmalloc:
01572   unregister_chrdev_region(chrdev,pscip_dev_number);
01573  err_chrdev_region:
01574   pci_unregister_driver(&pscip_driver);
01575  err_pci_register:   
01576  return -ENOMEM;
01577 } 
01578 /* end init_module */
01579 
01581 module_init(init_pscip_module);
01583 module_exit(exit_pscip_module);
Generated on Fri Dec 5 17:49:43 2008 by  1.5.7.1
